verses.verse: Now <WG1161> I make <WG1107> known <WG1107> to you, brethren, <WG80> the gospel <WG2098> which <WG3739> I preached <WG2097> to you, which <WG3739> also <WG2532> you received, <WG3880> in which <WG3739> also <WG2532> you stand, <WG2476>

by which <WG3739> also <WG2532> you are saved, <WG4982> if <WG1487> you hold <WG2722> fast <WG2722> the word <WG3056> which <WG5101> I preached <WG2097> to you, unless <WG1487> <WG3361> you believed <WG4100> in vain. <WG1500>

For I delivered <WG3860> to you as of first <WG4413> importance <WG4413> what <WG3739> I also <WG2532> received, <WG3880> that Christ <WG5547> died <WG599> for our sins <WG266> according <WG2596> to the Scriptures, <WG1124>
and that He was buried, <WG2290> and that He was raised <WG1453> on the third <WG5154> day <WG2250> according <WG2596> to the Scriptures, <WG1124>
and that He appeared <WG3708> to Cephas, <WG2786> then <WG1534> to the twelve. <WG1427>

After <WG1899> that He appeared <WG3708> to more <WG1883> than <WG1883> five <WG4001> hundred <WG4001> brethren <WG80> at one <WG2178> time, <WG2178> most <WG4183> of whom <WG3739> remain <WG3306> until <WG2193> now, <WG737> but some <WG5100> have fallen <WG2837> asleep; <WG2837>
then <WG1899> He appeared <WG3708> to James, <WG2385> then <WG1534> to all <WG3956> the apostles; <WG652>
and last <WG2078> of all, <WG3956> as it were to one <WG1626> untimely <WG1626> born, <WG1626> He appeared <WG3708> to me also. <WG2532>

For I am <WG1510> the least <WG1646> of the apostles, <WG652> who <WG3739> am <WG1510> not fit <WG2425> to be called <WG2564> an apostle, <WG652> because <WG1360> I persecuted <WG1377> the church <WG1577> of God. <WG2316>

But by the grace <WG5485> of God <WG2316> I am <WG1510> what <WG3739> I am, <WG1510> and His grace <WG5485> toward <WG1519> me did not prove <WG1096> vain; <WG2756> but I labored <WG2872> even <WG4053> more <WG4053> than all <WG3956> of them, yet <WG1161> not I, but the grace <WG5485> of God <WG2316> with me.
Whether <WG1535> then <WG3767> [it was] I or <WG1535> they, so <WG3779> we preach <WG2784> and so <WG3779> you believed. <WG4100>

Now <WG1161> if <WG1487> Christ <WG5547> is preached, <WG2784> that He has been raised <WG1453> from the dead, <WG3498> how <WG4459> do some <WG5100> among <WG1722> you say <WG3004> that there is no <WG3756> resurrection <WG386> of the dead <WG3498>?
But if <WG1487> there is no <WG3756> resurrection <WG386> of the dead, <WG3498> not even <WG3761> Christ <WG5547> has been raised; <WG1453>
and if <WG1487> Christ <WG5547> has not been raised, <WG1453> then <WG686> our preaching <WG2782> is vain, <WG2756> your faith <WG4102> also <WG2532> is vain. <WG2756>

Moreover <WG1161> we are even <WG2532> found <WG2147> [to be] false <WG5577> witnesses <WG5577> of God, <WG2316> because <WG3754> we witnessed <WG3140> against <WG2596> God <WG2316> that He raised <WG1453> Christ, <WG5547> whom <WG3739> He did not raise, <WG1453> if <WG1512> in fact <WG686> the dead <WG3498> are not raised. <WG1453>
For if <WG1487> the dead <WG3498> are not raised, <WG1453> not even <WG3761> Christ <WG5547> has been raised; <WG1453>
and if <WG1487> Christ <WG5547> has not been raised, <WG1453> your faith <WG4102> is worthless; <WG3152> you are still <WG2089> in your sins. <WG266>
Then <WG686> those <WG3588> also <WG2532> who have fallen <WG2837> asleep <WG2837> in Christ <WG5547> have perished. <WG622>
If <WG1487> we have hoped <WG1679> in Christ <WG5547> in this <WG3778> life <WG2222> only, <WG3440> we are of all <WG3956> men <WG444> most <WG1652> to be pitied. <WG1652>
But now <WG3570> Christ <WG5547> has been raised <WG1453> from the dead, <WG3498> the first <WG536> fruits <WG536> of those <WG3588> who are asleep. <WG2837>
For since <WG1894> by a man <WG444> [came] death, <WG2288> by a man <WG444> also <WG2532> [came] the resurrection <WG386> of the dead. <WG3498>
For as in Adam <WG76> all <WG3956> die, <WG599> so <WG3779> also <WG2532> in Christ <WG5547> all <WG3956> shall be made <WG2227> alive. <WG2227>
But each <WG1538> in his own <WG2398> order: <WG5001> Christ <WG5547> the first <WG536> fruits, <WG536> after <WG1899> that those <WG3588> who <WG3588> are Christ's at His coming, <WG3952>

then <WG1534> [comes] the end, <WG5056> when <WG3752> He delivers <WG3860> up the kingdom <WG932> to the God <WG2316> and Father, <WG3962> when <WG3752> He has abolished <WG2673> all <WG3956> rule <WG746> and all <WG3956> authority <WG1849> and power. <WG1411>
For He must <WG1163> reign <WG936> until <WG891> He has put <WG5087> all <WG3956> His enemies <WG2190> under <WG5259> His feet. <WG4228>
The last <WG2078> enemy <WG2190> that will be abolished <WG2673> is death. <WG2288>

For He has put <WG5293> all <WG3956> things <WG3956> in subjection <WG5293> under <WG5259> His feet. <WG4228> But when <WG3752> He says, <WG3004> "All <WG3956> things <WG3956> are put <WG5293> in subjection, <WG5293>" it is evident <WG1212> that He is excepted <WG1622> who put <WG5293> all <WG3956> things <WG3956> in subjection <WG5293> to Him.

And when <WG3752> all <WG3956> things <WG3956> are subjected <WG5293> to Him, then <WG5119> the Son <WG5207> Himself <WG846> also <WG2532> will be subjected <WG5293> to the One who subjected <WG5293> all <WG3956> things <WG3956> to Him, that God <WG2316> may be all <WG3956> in all. <WG3956>

Otherwise, <WG1893> what <WG5101> will those <WG3588> do <WG4160> who are baptized <WG907> for the dead <WG3498>? If <WG1487> the dead <WG3498> are not raised <WG1453> at all, <WG3654> why <WG5101> then <WG2532> are they baptized <WG907> for them?
Why <WG5101> are we also <WG2532> in danger <WG2793> every <WG3956> hour <WG5610>?
I protest, <WG3513> brethren, <WG80> by the boasting <WG2746> in you, which <WG3739> I have <WG2192> in Christ <WG5547> Jesus <WG2424> our Lord, <WG2962> I die <WG599> daily. <WG2596> <WG2250>

If <WG1487> from human <WG444> motives <WG2596> I fought <WG2341> with wild <WG2341> beasts <WG2341> at Ephesus, <WG2181> what <WG5101> does it profit <WG3786> me? If <WG1487> the dead <WG3498> are not raised, <WG1453> let us eat <WG2068> and drink, <WG4095> for tomorrow <WG839> we die. <WG599>
Do not be deceived: <WG4105> "Bad <WG2556> company <WG3657> corrupts <WG5351> good <WG5543> morals. <WG2239>"

Become <WG1594> sober-minded as you ought, <WG1346> and stop <WG3361> sinning; <WG264> for some <WG5100> have <WG2192> no <WG56> knowledge <WG56> of God. <WG2316> I speak <WG2980> [this] to your shame. <WG1791>
But someone <WG5100> will say, <WG3004> "How <WG4459> are the dead <WG3498> raised <WG1453>? And with what <WG4169> kind <WG4169> of body <WG4983> do they come <WG2064>?"
You fool! <WG878> That which <WG3739> you sow <WG4687> does not come <WG2227> to life <WG2227> unless <WG1437> <WG3361> it dies; <WG599>

and that which <WG3739> you sow, <WG4687> you do not sow <WG4687> the body <WG4983> which is to be, but a bare <WG1131> grain, <WG2848> perhaps <WG5177> of wheat <WG4621> or <WG2228> of something <WG5100> else. <WG3062>
But God <WG2316> gives <WG1325> it a body <WG4983> just <WG2531> as He wished, <WG2309> and to each <WG1538> of the seeds <WG4690> a body <WG4983> of its own. <WG2398>

All <WG3956> flesh <WG4561> is not the same <WG846> flesh, <WG4561> but there is one <WG243> [flesh <WG4561>] of men, <WG444> and another <WG243> flesh <WG4561> of beasts, <WG2934> and another <WG243> flesh of birds, <WG4421> and another <WG243> of fish. <WG2486>

There are also <WG2532> heavenly <WG2032> bodies <WG4983> and earthly <WG1919> bodies, <WG4983> but the glory <WG1391> of the heavenly <WG2032> is one, <WG2087> and the [glory] of the earthly <WG1919> is another. <WG2087>

There is one <WG243> glory <WG1391> of the sun, <WG2246> and another <WG243> glory <WG1391> of the moon, <WG4582> and another <WG243> glory <WG1391> of the stars; <WG792> for star <WG792> differs <WG1308> from star <WG792> in glory. <WG1391>
So <WG3779> also <WG2532> is the resurrection <WG386> of the dead. <WG3498> It is sown <WG4687> a perishable <WG5356> [body], it is raised <WG1453> an imperishable <WG861> [body];
it is sown <WG4687> in dishonor, <WG819> it is raised <WG1453> in glory; <WG1391> it is sown <WG4687> in weakness, <WG769> it is raised <WG1453> in power; <WG1411>

it is sown <WG4687> a natural <WG5591> body, <WG4983> it is raised <WG1453> a spiritual <WG4152> body. <WG4983> If <WG1487> there is a natural <WG5591> body, <WG4983> there is also <WG2532> a spiritual <WG4152> [body.]

So <WG3779> also <WG2532> it is written, <WG1125> "The first <WG4413> man, <WG444> Adam, <WG76> became <WG1096> a living <WG2198> soul. <WG5590>" The last <WG2078> Adam <WG76> [became] a life-giving spirit. <WG4151>
However, <WG235> the spiritual <WG4152> is not first, <WG4413> but the natural; <WG5591> then <WG1899> the spiritual. <WG4152>
The first <WG4413> man <WG444> is from the earth, <WG1093> earthy; <WG5517> the second <WG1208> man <WG444> is from heaven. <WG3772>

As is the earthy, <WG5517> so <WG5108> also <WG2532> are those <WG3588> who are earthy; <WG5517> and as is the heavenly, <WG2032> so <WG5108> also <WG2532> are those <WG3588> who are heavenly. <WG2032>
And just <WG2531> as we have borne <WG5409> the image <WG1504> of the earthy, <WG5517> we shall also <WG2532> bear <WG5409> the image <WG1504> of the heavenly. <WG2032>

Now <WG1161> I say <WG5346> this, <WG3778> brethren, <WG80> that flesh <WG4561> and blood <WG129> cannot <WG1410> <WG3756> inherit <WG2816> the kingdom <WG932> of God; <WG2316> nor <WG3761> does the perishable <WG5356> inherit <WG2816> the imperishable. <WG861>
Behold, <WG2400> I tell <WG3004> you a mystery; <WG3466> we shall not all <WG3956> sleep, <WG2837> but we shall all <WG3956> be changed, <WG236>

in a moment, <WG823> in the twinkling <WG4493> of an eye, <WG3788> at the last <WG2078> trumpet; <WG4536> for the trumpet <WG4537> will sound, <WG4537> and the dead <WG3498> will be raised <WG1453> imperishable, <WG862> and we shall be changed. <WG236>
For this <WG3778> perishable <WG5349> must <WG1163> put <WG1746> on the imperishable, <WG861> and this <WG3778> mortal <WG2349> must put <WG1746> on immortality. <WG110>

But when <WG3752> this <WG3778> perishable <WG5349> will have put <WG1746> on the imperishable, <WG861> and this <WG3778> mortal <WG2349> will have put <WG1746> on immortality, <WG110> then <WG5119> will come <WG1096> about the saying <WG3056> that is written, <WG1125> "Death <WG2288> is swallowed <WG2666> up in victory. <WG3534>
"O death, <WG2288> where <WG4226> is your victory <WG3534>? O death, <WG2288> where <WG4226> is your sting <WG2759>?"
The sting <WG2759> of death <WG2288> is sin, <WG266> and the power <WG1411> of sin <WG266> is the law; <WG3551>
but thanks <WG5485> be to God, <WG2316> who gives <WG1325> us the victory <WG3534> through <WG1223> our Lord <WG2962> Jesus <WG2424> Christ. <WG5547>

Therefore, <WG5620> my beloved <WG27> brethren, <WG80> be steadfast, <WG1476> immovable, <WG277> always <WG3842> abounding <WG4052> in the work <WG2041> of the Lord, <WG2962> knowing <WG3609> that your toil <WG2873> is not [in] vain <WG2756> in the Lord. <WG2962>
